document_data.name: Copperbloom
document_data.languages: [[Saurial language|Saurial]], [[Draconic language|Draconic]], [[Common]] (can understand, read, and write)
document_data.mainbody: '''Copperbloom''' was one of the elder spiritual leaders of the [[Lost Vale Tribe]], the [[saurial]] community in the [[Dalelands]], the mate of saurial hero [[Dragonbait]] and the mother of their offspring - [[Handful]] and two other hatchlings.
document_data.Description: Copperbloom looked like a typical [[finhead]] saurial. When she was performing her [[priest]]ly duties in the [[Singing Cave]] - a Temple of Finder Wyvernspur, she was adorned in the typical [[robe]]s of the [[Church of Finder Wyvernspur]] - simple but elegant garments, guided by the dogma that the outfit of the performer should not outshine the performance. When Copperbloom was on the road, she wore practical and simple travelers' clothes. Thankfully, like most other saurials, she relied on natural defenses of her scales.{{Cite polyhedron/119/Forgotten Deities: Finder Wyvernspur|23}}
document_data.Personality: Copperbloom was a kind and gentle woman with keen intelligence. She often lovingly scolded her deity Finder when the fledgling deity made mistakes. Like with many other followers, Finder was friends with his clerics and devotees.
document_data.Abilities: Apart from being a competent cleric with access to divine magic and blessings of [[Finder Wyvernspur]], Copperbloom was a talented poet, musician, and songwriter. Her talents were respected among saurials and [[human]]s. Her religion was focused not just on change and the evolution of music but also on individual change. She embraced that aspect of the church and quickly mastered [[Common]] language (reading, writing, and understanding, however, her saurial physiology stopped her from speaking in the alien language).
document_data.Relationships: Copperbloom shared her spiritual leadership status with [[Sweetleaf]], and older bladeback [[cleric]] of [[Chauntea]] and the goddess of fertility and agriculture from the saurial homeworld. Together, the woman guided and trained eight acolytes who, like their superiors, worshiped Finder Wyvernspur and Chauntea.
